summary: Build the VitaSense app focused on future AI health-related capabilities.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimal VitaSense wordmark logo with a subtle leaf/heartbeat motif (vitasense-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Soft wellness-themed abstract hero illustration with warm neutral tones and minimal shapes (vitasense-hero.dim_1600x900.png)

existing_features.title: Create the initial VitaSense frontend with a public landing page that explains the product (future AI health-related app), includes a clear call-to-action to sign in, and shows a brief disclaimer that the app is not medical advice.
Add Internet Identity sign-in to the VitaSense app and display signed-in state (principal) in the UI, with sign-out support.
Create a signed-in dashboard UI that lets the user view and edit their VitaSense profile (name, age range, health goals) and saves it via the backend.

Add a simple health log feature (MVP) that allows a signed-in user to create and view time-stamped entries for a small set of daily metrics (e.g., mood 1–5, sleep hours, notes). Store per-user entries in the backend and display them in the dashboard.
Include a “Future AI Insights” page/section that is explicitly labeled as “coming soon” and describes (in English) what future AI features might do, without implementing any AI integration.

Establish a coherent visual theme for VitaSense (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) appropriate for a health/wellness product, and apply it consistently across landing, auth, dashboard, and log flows (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette).
Add generated static brand assets for VitaSense (logo + simple hero illustration) and use them on the landing page and app header. Store them as static files and do not serve them from the backend.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create VitaSense app for future AI health-related use cases
Implement a basic backend user profile model keyed by the caller principal, with endpoints to create/read/update a profile (name, age range, health goals text, createdAt/updatedAt timestamps).
